page.title: 09CORNISH CROSSES
page.content: In our D- block there are many Cornish crosses although they are not marked on the Ordnance Survey map .They are between 6 and 8 feet high . They are made out of granite .The top is carved in the shape of a cross on a round piece of granite They used them before permanent church buildings were erected for praying at instead of a church .They would put small huts over the crosses to keep warm and to keep themselves dry .They were usually put at a cross roads. There sometimes was writing on them .Some of them in our area have been moved from their original site;there are three at Lanteglos Church and a memorial stone to a man who died in the tenth century.They should not be confused with granite scratching posts for cattle which you can see in some fields.
